info.question: EBS Snapshots are backed up to S3 in what manner?
answers: EBS snapshots are not stored on S3

info.question: Do Amazon EBS volumes persist independently from the life of an Amazon EC2 instance, for example, if I terminated an EC2 instance, would that EBS volume remain?
answers: Only if instructed to when created
correctAnswer: Only if instructed to when created

info.question: Can I delete a snapshot of an EBS Volume that is used as the root device of a registered AMI?
What must you do before you can delete a snapshot of an EBS Volume that is used as the root device of a registered AMI?
answers: you can't delete a snapshot of the root device of a registered AMI
copy the AMI to another region

info.question: A placement group can be deployed across multiple Availability Zones.
While creating the snapshots using the command line tools, which command should I be using?
Can you attach an EBS volume to more than one EC2 instance at the same time?
answers: If that EC2 volume is part of an AMI

info.question: A placement group is ideal for
answers: Distributing content on a CDN network
EC2 instances that require high disk IO
EC2 Instances that require low latency and high network throughput across multiple availability zones.
EC2 instances that require high network throughput and low latency across a single availability zone.
correctAnswer: EC2 instances that require high network throughput and low latency across a single availability zone.

info.question: Using the console, I can add a role to an EC2 instance, after that instance has been created and powered up.
I can change the permissions to a role, even if that role is already assigned to an existing EC2 instance, and these changes will take effect immediately.
